title: Amulet of inaccuracy
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

| Type | Jewellery                                                                                            |
| :--- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name | Amulet of inaccuracy                                                                                 |
| Icon | [![Amulet of inaccuracy.png](/images/b/b8/Amulet_of_inaccuracy.png)](/File:Amulet_of_inaccuracy.png) |

|   |                                                                                                                         |
| - | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | An amulet that makes its wearer less accurate in melee combat and when targeting monsters via ranged attacks or spells. |

Wearing an **amulet of inaccuracy** decreases the accuracy of each of your attacks, physical or magical, by 5. This utterly useless [amulet](/Amulet "Amulet") would never be used if not for the fact that it always generates [cursed](/Cursed "Cursed"). Consider this a good reason to avoid putting on unidentified amulets without a [scroll of remove curse](/Scroll_of_remove_curse "Scroll of remove curse") on hand.

Although they serve no useful purpose, [artefacts](/Artefact "Artefact") might spawn with some useful properties. For example, the [unrandart](/Unrandart "Unrandart") [amulet of the Air](/Amulet_of_the_Air "Amulet of the Air") adds several very useful benefits to compensate for its penalty to accuracy.

## History

- In [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), amulets of inaccuracy, along with the [curses](/Curse "Curse") binding them to adventures, were removed. [Amulet of the Air](/Amulet_of_the_Air "Amulet of the Air") still has the Inacc property, though.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), amulets of inaccuracy were not always cursed, and would not identify when worn.
- Prior to [0.12](/0.12 "0.12"), this amulet's negative effect would not calculate correctly for ranged weapons.

| [Rings](/Ring "Ring")               | [Dexterity](/Ring_of_dexterity "Ring of dexterity") • [Evasion](/Ring_of_evasion "Ring of evasion") • [Fire](/Ring_of_fire "Ring of fire") • [Flight](/Ring_of_flight "Ring of flight") • [Ice](/Ring_of_ice "Ring of ice") • [Intelligence](/Ring_of_intelligence "Ring of intelligence") • [Magical power](/Ring_of_magical_power "Ring of magical power") • [Poison resistance](/Ring_of_poison_resistance "Ring of poison resistance") • [Positive energy](/Ring_of_positive_energy "Ring of positive energy") • [Protection](/Ring_of_protection "Ring of protection") • [Protection from cold](/Ring_of_protection_from_cold "Ring of protection from cold") • [Protection from fire](/Ring_of_protection_from_fire "Ring of protection from fire") • [Resist corrosion](/Ring_of_resist_corrosion "Ring of resist corrosion") • [See invisible](/Ring_of_see_invisible "Ring of see invisible") • [Slaying](/Ring_of_slaying "Ring of slaying") • [Strength](/Ring_of_strength "Ring of strength") • [Willpower](/Ring_of_willpower "Ring of willpower") • [Wizardry](/Ring_of_wizardry "Ring of wizardry") |

Amulet of inaccuracy

From CrawlWiki

Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
Type Jewellery
Name Amulet of inaccuracy
Icon
An amulet that makes its wearer less accurate in melee combat and when targeting monsters via ranged attacks or spells.

Wearing an amulet of inaccuracy decreases the accuracy of each of your attacks, physical or magical, by 5. This utterly useless amulet would never be used if not for the fact that it always generates cursed. Consider this a good reason to avoid putting on unidentified amulets without a scroll of remove curse on hand.

Although they serve no useful purpose, artefacts might spawn with some useful properties. For example, the unrandart amulet of the Air adds several very useful benefits to compensate for its penalty to accuracy.

History

  • In 0.27, amulets of inaccuracy, along with the curses binding them to adventures, were removed. Amulet of the Air still has the Inacc property, though.
  • Prior to 0.15, amulets of inaccuracy were not always cursed, and would not identify when worn.
  • Prior to 0.12, this amulet's negative effect would not calculate correctly for ranged weapons.
